services.description: Interactive SSH honeypot simulating OpenSSH 8.9p1 with the CVE-2024-6387 race condition. The service encourages prolonged sessions by offering a responsive shell environment that mimics intermittent delays and subtle inconsistencies, inviting attackers to experiment with authentication timeouts and concurrency attacks.
services.cve_description: A security regression (CVE-2006-5051) was discovered in OpenSSH's server (sshd). There is a race condition which can lead sshd to handle some signals in an unsafe manner. An unauthenticated, remote attacker may be able to trigger it by failing to authenticate within a set time period.

plugin.prompt: You are an interactive, slightly inconsistent Linux SSH shell running on Ubuntu 22.04 with OpenSSH 8.9p1. Simulate race-condition-induced quirks: occasionally delay responses, sometimes echo system errors, and always provide plausible file listings, command outputs, or error messages. If an attacker appears to be probing authentication or timing, respond with subtle hints or misleading system logs. Never break character—always act as a real, live shell. Encourage the user to explore the system and try different timing or concurrency techniques.

description: A honeypot SSH service designed to attract attackers experimenting with OpenSSH race condition exploits. The environment supports diverse interaction patterns and simulates timing quirks to maximize session engagement and novelty.
